title: Falconhead Airport
text:
Falconhead Airport is a public use <a href="airport">airport</a> located two <a href="nautical%20mile">nautical mile</a>s (2.3 <a href="mile">mi</a>, 3.7 <a href="kilometre">km</a>) northwest of the <a href="central%20business%20district">central business district</a> of <a href="Burneyville%2C%20Oklahoma">Burneyville</a>, in <a href="Love%20County%2C%20Oklahoma">Love County</a>, <a href="Oklahoma">Oklahoma</a>, <a href="United%20States">United States</a>. It is privately owned by Falconhead Airport and Aviation Services, LLC.
The airport is located adjacent to the <a href="Burneyville%2C%20Oklahoma%23Falconhead%20Resort%20%26amp%3B%20Country%20Club">Falconhead Resort & Country Club</a>.
Facilities and aircraft.
Falconhead Airport covers an area of at an <a href="elevation">elevation</a> of 690 feet (210 m) above <a href="mean%20sea%20level">mean sea level</a>. It has one <a href="runway">runway</a> designated 18/36 with an <a href="asphalt">asphalt</a> surface measuring 4,400 by 75 feet (1,341 x 23 m).
For the 12-month period ending January 6, 2010, the airport had 460 aircraft operations, an average of 38 per month: 98% <a href="general%20aviation">general aviation</a> and 2% <a href="military%20aviation">military</a>. At that time there were 6 aircraft based at this airport: 83% single-<a href="aircraft%20engine">engine</a> and 17% multi-engine.
